title: At '''Startup'.'', Firefoxit displays window from previous session -- The "Open previous windows and tabs" option is NOT checked
content:
Firefox's behavior changed, after v116.0.1 (64-bit) was installed. My "Setting" selection is (and always has been) is the default (display Home Page)

My OS is Win 10 Pro v22H2 (OS Build 19045.3208)
creator: DickB19

title: Google search intermittently takes about a 30 seconds to load
content:
Intermittently (maybe 1/20 times?), when I try to do a Google search from the URL bar I'll get a tab that doesn't load for about 30 seconds. If I search for the exact same thing in another tab it will load instantly, and if I select the url and press enter it will also load instantly. I am seeing this issue both when entering a search and when selecting text and clicking "Search Google for X".

I found a recommendation on a similar issue to set security.tls.enable_0rtt_data = false in about:config but I have seen no change with that setting.
creator: iondune

title: Amazon web page stopped working with latest Firefox upgrade.
content: The latest update to Firefox now requires me to turn off AdBlockPlus for the Amazon web page to function correctly. It worked fine for years, why change it now. It's so frustrating to suddenly have to start troubleshooting after an update. It happens all too often with Firefox.
creator: locoarchy

title: Inspect Element is huge and customer service/tech support or researching knowledgebase produces no results.
content:
Technical support/customer service and hordes of other baseline staff, supervisors and managers at the actual company have been contacted about this numerous times, however they only have 3 abilities 1 Research the Web/keyword a knowledgebase 2 Recite prerecorded A) answers to frequently asked questions B) explanations of company policy 3 Redirect to other departments admin levels agencies or companies all of which have the same 3 abilities so what some volunteers can do that are not engineers and not employees I don't know.

Maybe this is one reason why everybody is migrating to Chrome - that and the increasing number of websites that don't function in Firefox anymore regardless of the build.

This creates numerous stalemates all looping one back over the other over the other over the other like electrons in an atom and no resolution is forthcoming. Maybe this is why everybody is migrating to Chrome. That and so many websites don't work on Firefox anymore.

Right clicking to bring up the Developer Panel to e g erase i.e. paywalls and other similar annoyances and impediments to browsing (especially when they slow down and or crash the computer) however now the developer panel type and size is so huge you can't use it for the same purpose.

As stated above, the three normally recommended solutions have produced no results.

Windows 7 here due to our business depending on a large number of programs that i) have not been rewritten for Windows 10 ii) the Windows 7 versions don't run on Windows 10 including in a Windows 7 shell so the common redirect to upgrading the OS is not an option at this time.
creator: jway01

title: This last Firefox update had totally screwed up everyone's browser.  Especially maps.
content: This last Firefox update had totally screwed up everyone's browser. Especially maps. Half of my maps, especially on Find A Grave no longer work. I dont know what you guys did, but you need to fix it fast!
creator: wvsky

title: Problema con "esc" para salir de la pantalla completa de una reproduccion de video
content:
hola, tengo el problema de que al estar en pantalla completa de un video de youtube, twitch, etc. al apretar "ESC" en mi teclado, no me saca de la pantalla completa, no hace nada, trate de buscar alguna forma de ver si esta activa pero no encontré ninguna, revise la configuraron de mi teclado de mac y esta todo correcto

¿quisiera saber como puedo revisar y solucionar ese problema para salir de la pantalla completa con "ESC"?
creator: r.sotoledo

title: Auto fill not my email addresses
content:
This is a many years old account/install with Netscape/Firefox, now 116.0.1, 64-bit Windows.

When offered a box for email step 1 login -- this site, for example -- FF auto fill offers my correct address first, but then there are two offered below that in the auto fill offers that are not mine.

How can I access where those are stored and remove those erroneous or mal email addresses?

Searching here infers the Profile; yes, my first guess, but my Profile is 725 MB ... so any hints available?
creator: bmcken2

title: Pages not loading properly
content: outlook.com, Facebook, and Starfleet Commander are not loading properly. It started with Starfleet Commander, and a clearing of cache and cookies routinely would temporarily clear it up. Now, I am having problems with both outlook.com and Facebook as well, and since the most recent Firefox update. outlook.com is opening but I cannot access the emails in my inbox and Facebook is unable to share posts. Also, in outlook.com, https links in emails from trusted senders are somehow being converted to http and then Firefox of course warns me not to go there. Of note, I downloaded Chrome temporarily for a backup and am not having these problems with Chrome, but of course, Google Chrome is nosy and ad-laden.
creator: KayTa
